metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3502 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in avahi 0.8-5. A reachable assertion is present inavahi_s_host_name_resolver_start function allowing a local attacker tocrash the avahi service by requesting hostname resolutions through theavahi socket or dbus methods for invalid hostnames. The highest threat fromthis vulnerability is to the service availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

avahi-autoipd - 0.8-5ubuntu4
avahi-daemon - 0.8-5ubuntu4
avahi-discover - 0.8-5ubuntu4
avahi-dnsconfd - 0.8-5ubuntu4
avahi-ui-utils - 0.8-5ubuntu4
avahi-utils - 0.8-5ubuntu4
gir1.2-avahi-0.6 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-client3 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-common-data - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-common3 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-core7 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-glib1 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-gobject0 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.8-5ubuntu4
python3-avahi - 0.8-5ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: avahi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8-5ubuntu4').
